titlestmt.titleproper: INTERNATIONAL BROTHERHOOD OF PAINTERS AND ALLIED TRADES OF THE UNITED STATES AND CANADA, LOCAL 201 RECORDS (APAP052)1900-1982
titlestmt.author: Geoffrey A. Huth

publicationstmt.publisher: M. E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives
publicationstmt.date: Copyright 2015 By the University at Albany, SUNY. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: International Brotherhood of Painters and Allied Trades of the United States and Canada, Local 201 Records1900-1982
did.abstract: The collection documents the history of the unions that formed Painters and Allied Trades Local 201, including Local 12 of Troy, Local 62 of Schenectady, and Local 201 of Albany.

origination.corpname: International Brotherhood of Painters and Allied Trades. Local 201 (Albany Metropolitan Area (N.Y.)

did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: M. E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University at Albany, SUNY

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: Painters and Allied Trades Local 201 represent painters in Albany, Schenectady, and Rensselaer counties of New York. The local was formed in 1982 from a merger of Local 12 of Troy, Local 62 of Schenectady, and Local 201 of Albany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The collection contains minutes of Local 62 (1936-1944, 1965-1982), and Local 201 (1962-1981), membership ledgers of Local 12 (1922-1951, and contracts of Local 201. Local 201's minutes from 1978-1981 are closed until further notice.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection has no series, arranged chronologically by local and then chronologically by records.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: All items in this manuscript group were donated to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, by Local 201 of the International Brotherhood of Painters and Allied Trade.1990 July

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this record group is unrestricted.

prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:
